content.description:
Short but very enjoyable route. Stick clip the first bolt. Walk up the ramp to a large juggy block. Fun movement though incut horizontal cracks and jugs brings you to the top. 



From the right end of the creek wall (Pink Buffalo) walk to the climbers right along the base for ~45m to reach this climb. Located on far left side of The Beach area on a small vertical face.

Stick clip. 2bolts and rap rings

climbs.name: Cover Girl
climbs.fa: Caleb Mazurkiewicz, Dalton MacNeil and Duncan Gillies

content.description:
Start by gaining the ledge and moving left until you can clip the first bolt. P1 crux is getting established on the climb. Following two more bolts and some gear to optional belay near the upper of the two large trees (P1 10m). From this tree step right and move up a short corner placing gear until you reach a bolt on a large ledge.  Continue moving up and left on ledge until you reach a bolt on a short head wall. Either traverse left until you reach an obvious right trending weakness (5.3) or go directly up at the bolt pulling one ~5.7 move over the hump to reach the weakness. Easy climbing on good hold and some more gear brings you to the top. (P2 25m)

Can be done in one pitch, requires 70m to reach the ground *tie back up knots*



Locate three bolts that lead towards two large trees on the bottom half of the cliff. This route climbs just right of these trees. 


6 bolts. Standard rack. Rap rings. Walk off right or rappel with 70m tie knots.

Locate a shallow left facing seam and diagonal incut seems. Climb up to large ledge and move towards a discontinuous corner crack system. Either build a belay here or continue up the corner on cleaner terrain eventually stepping slightly left. Continue past pockets, slots and seems in a groove to reach the top. 

*This route is currently undergoing cleaning.



Near the base of the slab there is a large block. this route starts to the climbers left of this block near two small trees. 

Standard rack. bring alpine draws. Uses small oak tree for anchor until bolted anchor is added.

climbs.name: Sandy Crack
climbs.fa: Dalton MacNeil,  Caleb Mazurkiewicz and Duncan Gillies

content.description:
Start by traversing up and left until you reach a short vertical crack that splits the head wall. After making a few moves gain the ledge and head for a bolt on easy terrain. After clipping the bolt either move directly up or step right until you can reach better holds to get you over the buldge. Follow the obvious cracks on the slab to the tree.



Access this route via the ledge on the right side of the wall (10m up from the base). Walk the base right until its possible to cut back left up the cliff.

Standard rack. 1 bolt . Chains on tree.
Currently undergoing significant cleaning but will take a while. Large 25-40meters low angle slab with a few head walls and ledges. Once all cleaned this will be a great area for beginners.
